### PR summary [fca13ff169](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/22484/commits/fca13ff16954ea6522c2c66cfc96f67cdd41cd0b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
There are 4968 files with changed transitive imports taking up over 213913 characters: this is too many to display!
You can run `scripts/import_trans_difference.sh all` locally to see the whole output.

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>Decrease in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.03)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|3158|-1|porting notes|
|34|-1|large files|

Current commit [fca13ff169](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/fca13ff16954ea6522c2c66cfc96f67cdd41cd0b)
Reference commit [fa9b36533f](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/fa9b36533f4059e2df709cff88edc6d9091cd4a6)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> I was hoping we could make some gains on the import structure: did you see a way to reduce the imports required for `Data.Set.Basic`, or is this pretty much the best we can do?

There's not much below `Data.Set.Basic`:

[o.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19061916/o.pdf)


We could probably get GaloisConnections.Defs and Order.Monotone out of the way? Not sure how valuable that would be.
Ya√´l took a look at `GaloisConnection.Defs` and we decided it's not worth shaking that bit further. And `Monotone` too is already quite minimal. So indeed you're right, this is the best we can do :)
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Vierkantor.

This looks good to me, but I did push a few fixes. So I'd like to ask for another maintainer to make the final judgement.

maintainer merge
I was hoping we could make some gains on the import structure: did you see a way to reduce the imports required for `Data.Set.Basic`, or is this pretty much the best we can do?

This looks good to me, but I did push a few fixes. So I'd like to ask for another maintainer to make the final judgement.

maintainer merge

Let's keep this back in the old shape :)
```suggestion
import Mathlib.Data.Set.Basic
import Mathlib.Tactic.Common
```

I was hoping we could make some gains on the import structure: did you see a way to reduce the imports required for `Data.Set.Basic`, or is this pretty much the best we can do?

> I was hoping we could make some gains on the import structure: did you see a way to reduce the imports required for `Data.Set.Basic`, or is this pretty much the best we can do?

There's not much below `Data.Set.Basic`:

[o.pdf](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19061916/o.pdf)


We could probably get GaloisConnections.Defs and Order.Monotone out of the way? Not sure how valuable that would be.

This looks good to me, but I did push a few fixes. So I'd like to ask for another maintainer to make the final judgement.
